byline.original: By CARLOTTA GALL and FARAH SAMTI

abstract: Tourists on beach in Sousse, Tunisia, recall silent, nearly businesslike behavior of gunman Seifeddine Rezgui as he carried out Tunisia's worst terrorist attack in living memory; Rezqui killed 39 people and wounded 38 others as he pursued sunbathers into the Imperial Marhaba Hotel before being shot and killed by police; witnesses say Rezgui's few words made it clear his targets were tourists.
lead_paragraph: The killer pursued sunbathers from the beach to the pool and eventually to the administration offices of the Imperial Marhaba Hotel, slaying 39 people and wounding 38 others.

headline.main: Gunman Focused on Tourists in Slaughter at a Tunisian Beach Hotel
headline.print_headline: Gunman Focused on Tourists in Slaughter at a Tunisian Beach Hotel

snippet: The killer pursued sunbathers from the beach to the pool and eventually to the administration offices of the Imperial Marhaba Hotel, slaying 39 people and wounding 38 others.
